channel.title: Snow Landscape [divi]
channel.description:
This is sort of out of season, its April ;D
Anyway, this could be good in December, so I dont know why I suddenly got inspiration for a Snow effect.... I guess the brain works in mysterious ways..
you have to use SCAR Divi, because it has useful functions like Rand and HSLToColor
this uses all TCanvas, hopefully this will help some people learn it, it also has a lot of constants, so you can easily mess around with it

item.title: Snow Landscape [divi]

item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Once again yakman, your scripting prowess leaves me utterly speechless…

I especially like how the snow changes direction of how it falls. (Like side to side as opposed to straight down the whole time).

it is useful because it shows the use of Canvasses and can help people learn some graphics techniques, also it looks nice
you probably wont see any ‘useful’ scripts from me because I keep them to myself

item.title: Snow Landscape [divi]
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

No its all the same Scar language, I just used it’s canvas

you can add the snowman clothes yourself if you want, but IMO, colors like orange and yellow break up the feeling of coldness, I purposly stuck to black, blue and white colors for this.
the main thing isnt the snowman, its the snow falling effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Snow Landscape [divi]
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Wow…

That’s amazing. Where do you learn so much about canvases? Is it a different coding language or a different program you use to make them? That’s amazing lol.

You forgot the corn cob pipe and a button nose (frosty the snowman lol) And you should add a carrot nose and a top hat.

Read full topic
